Draw a second arc with the same properties as the first one, but with a start point at (0.4528, 0.7337), mid point at (0.1352, 0.3668), and end point at (0.4528, 0). 3. Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.7337. 4. Draw a face and create a circle on it with a center at (0.0276, 0.0276) and radius 0.0276. 2. Draw a second face and create a circle on it with a center at (0.0276, 0.2892) and radius 0.0276. 3. Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.3169. 4. Extrude the sketch by 0.0727 towards the normal direction. Final shape The final shape consists of the above three parts. The cylindrical object (part 1) has a flat top and bottom, connected by a cylindrical section. The object has two small protrusions on the top and bottom, created by parts 2 and 3. The overall shape is a cylindrical object with a height of 0.75, length of 0.7337, and width of 0.0901.</description>
